abstract.p: Rep Loretta Sanchez, yielding to pressure from Vice Pres Al Gore and other Democratic leaders, agrees to move Hispanic fund-raising event from Playboy mansion in Los Angeles to Universal Studios (S)

block.p: Yielding to pressure from Vice President Al Gore and other Democratic Party leaders, Representative Loretta Sanchez tonight agreed to move a Hispanic fund-raising event from the Playboy Mansion to Universal Studios.

Ms. Sanchez, a California Democrat, had been removed from the speaker's list at the Democratic National Convention and faced further punishment from the party's leadership after she refused to move the event, which is to raise money to bring out the Hispanic vote.

Yielding to pressure from Vice President Al Gore and other Democratic Party leaders, Representative Loretta Sanchez tonight agreed to move a Hispanic fund-raising event from the Playboy Mansion to Universal Studios.

Ms. Sanchez, a California Democrat, had been removed from the speaker's list at the Democratic National Convention and faced further punishment from the party's leadership after she refused to move the event, which is to raise money to bring out the Hispanic vote.
Her speaking engagement and her position as Democratic party co-chairwoman were secured by her action, party leaders said.

''To continue to dwell on where our event is held, and whether my role as a D.N.C. officer conflicts with my role at a party for a good cause frankly makes no sense,'' Ms. Sanchez said in a statement. ''The only real party I am interested in is a party that represents real people, with real needs. That party is the Democratic Party.''
